page.title: 18HOUSING IN HEBBURN QUAY
page.content: Most of the{houses}in this area are about{100 yrs}old.They were built for {the workers in Leslie's}shipyard.They are{terraced}houses.The{council}bought them,then sold off about half at very low prices because they had no modern luxuries.These have been greatly {modernised}and the streets {pedestrianised}and are now worth about Â£15000 _ Â£20000.These streets are Ann, Price,Church and Parliament Street.The houses the council kept they demolished and in{1974}replaced them with new council housing.These are Cuthbert,William and Lyon Street.These are also terraced and many tenants have chosen to buy their council house.On average,there are 4 people per house.Only 2 houses have garages,they were police houses.
